description: |-
  Creates a new Alert Receiver object
---

# f5xc_alert_receiver (Resource)

Creates a new Alert Receiver object

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_alert_receiver" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the AlertReceiver. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the AlertReceiver will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `email` (Block, Optional) Email Configuration. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--email))
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.
- `opsgenie` (Block, Optional) OpsGenie Config. OpsGenie configuration to send alert notifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--opsgenie))
- `pagerduty` (Block, Optional) PagerDuty Config. PagerDuty configuration to send alert notifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--pagerduty))
- `slack` (Block, Optional) Slack Config. Slack configuration to send alert notifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--slack))
- `sms` (Block, Optional) SMS Configuration. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--sms))
- `webhook` (Block, Optional) Webhook Config. Webhook configuration to send alert notifications (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook))

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

### Nested Schema for `email`

Optional:

- `email` (String) Email. Email id of the user ves.io.schema.rules.string.email: true

### Nested Schema for `opsgenie`

Optional:

- `api_key` (Block, Optional) Secret. SecretType is used in an object to indicate a sensitive/confidential field (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key))
- `url` (String) API URL. URL to send API requests to Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

<a id="nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key"></a>
### Nested Schema for `opsgenie.api_key`

Optional:

- `blindfold_secret_info` (Block, Optional) Blindfold Secret. BlindfoldSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by F5XC Secret Management (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key--blindfold_secret_info))
- `clear_secret_info` (Block, Optional) In-Clear Secret. ClearSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret that is not encrypted. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key--clear_secret_info))

<a id="nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key--blindfold_secret_info"></a>
### Nested Schema for `opsgenie.api_key.blindfold_secret_info`

Optional:

- `decryption_provider` (String) Decryption Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.
- `location` (String) Location. Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:/// Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
- `store_provider` (String) Store Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///


<a id="nestedblock--opsgenie--api_key--clear_secret_info"></a>
### Nested Schema for `opsgenie.api_key.clear_secret_info`

Optional:

- `provider_ref` (String) Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///
- `url` (String) URL. URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///. For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format. When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072 ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

Optional:

- `basic_auth` (Block, Optional) Basic Authorization Credentials. Authorization parameters to access HTPP alert Receiver Endpoint. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--basic_auth))
- `client_cert_obj` (Block, Optional) Client Certificate Object. Configuration for client certificate (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--client_cert_obj))
- `enable_http2` (Boolean) Enable HTTP2. Configure to use HTTP2 protocol.
- `follow_redirects` (Boolean) Follow Redirects. Configure whether HTTP requests follow HTTP 3xx redirects.
- `no_authorization` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--no_authorization))
- `no_tls` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--no_tls))
- `use_tls` (Block, Optional) TLS Config. Configures the token request's TLS settings. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--use_tls))

### Nested Schema for `webhook.http_config.use_tls`

Optional:

- `disable_sni` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--use_tls--disable_sni))
- `max_version` (String) TLS Protocol. TlsProtocol is enumeration of supported TLS versions F5 Distributed Cloud will choose the optimal TLS version.
- `min_version` (String) TLS Protocol. TlsProtocol is enumeration of supported TLS versions F5 Distributed Cloud will choose the optimal TLS version.
- `sni` (String) SNI Value. Exclusive with [disable_sni] SNI value to be used. ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostname: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 256
- `use_server_verification` (Block, Optional) TLS Validation Context for Servers. Upstream TLS Validation Context (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--webhook--http_config--use_tls--use_server_verification))

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_alert_receiver.example system/example
```
